linkedin.post_text:
🔍 Is AEO the New SEO? AI Is Rewriting the Rules of Online Discovery

SEO changed the web forever by making us write for algorithms. Now, AI is changing how people search — and Answer Engine Optimization (AEO) is emerging as the new frontier.
You've probably seen it already: 
- Google’s AI Overviews (powered by Gemini) 
- ChatGPT’s clickable links and search tools 
- Perplexity summarizing answers instead of listing links
🚨 The shift?
-SEO = Optimize for keywords
-AEO = Optimize for answers
David Slater (ex-Mozilla, Salesforce) noted ~30 AEO-focused product launches in recent months — all aiming to do what SEO did 20 years ago.

⚙️ What AEO-Optimized Content Looks Like:
✅ Full-sentence, conversational answers
 ✅ Structured data + cited sources
 ✅ High-quality content that AI models can summarize, rank, and link to directly

💡 Why This Matters Now:
27% of Americans already prefer AI chatbots over Google
VCs are backing AEO startups (AI took 58% of global VC in Q1 2025)
ChatGPT is driving referral traffic via native search-like experiences
Neil Patel calls AEO a subset of SEO — you’re not starting from scratch

🔮 My Take:
We’re witnessing a generational shift in content strategy. SEO made content machine-readable. AEO makes content AI-conversational.

👉 Are you optimizing for answers, or still just keywords?

#AI #AEO #SEO #ContentStrategy #LLM #ChatGPT #Gemini #DigitalMarketing #SearchEvolution #AnswerEconomy

ZeroSearch by Alibaba: Key Points and Insights

What is ZeroSearch?

Core Concept: ZeroSearch is a new AI training method developed by Alibaba that trains large language models (LLMs) to perform search tasks using simulations instead of real-time queries to external search engines like Google. It transforms a reference model into a pseudo-search engine, enabling AI to generate search-like responses internally.

Cost Reduction: The note highlights a significant cost saving—running 64,000 queries via a traditional API (e.g., Google’s SerpAPI) costs $586, while ZeroSearch achieves the same for just $70, an 88% reduction.

Accessibility: By slashing costs, ZeroSearch makes advanced AI training accessible to smaller teams and startups, reducing reliance on expensive infrastructure

How Does ZeroSearch Work?

Simulation-Based Training: ZeroSearch uses a two-step process:
Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT): A reference LLM (e.g., 3B, 7B, or 14B parameters) is fine-tuned to act as a retrieval module, generating both relevant and “noisy” (irrelevant) documents in response to queries. This mimics real search engine behavior without actual API calls.

Reinforcement Learning (RL) with Curriculum Rollout: The quality of simulated documents is gradually degraded during training to simulate challenging scenarios, helping the AI learn to handle ambiguity and improve reasoning over time.

Performance Metrics: A 7B-parameter model matches Google Search performance, while a 14B-parameter model surpasses it (e.g., scoring 33.97 vs. Google’s 32.47 on benchmarks like Natural Questions and TriviaQA). This indicates ZeroSearch isn’t just cost-effective but also competitive in quality.

Applications and Impact :

Quark App and Deep Search: ZeroSearch powers Alibaba’s Quark app, noted as China’s most popular AI tool in 2025. Quark’s “deep search” feature combines Alibaba’s Qwen AI model (likely Qwen2.5 or Qwen3) with real-time results to provide context-aware answers, enhancing reasoning and generation capabilities.

Market Competition: The note mentions competitors like Baidu, DeepSeek, and Moonshot AI racing to upgrade their search AI with similar real-time tools, reflecting a broader trend in China’s AI landscape to integrate advanced search capabilities

Broader Implications: ZeroSearch signals a shift in AI development economics, reducing dependency on Big Tech platforms and potentially redefining search engines’ role in AI training.

#AIInnovation #ZeroSearchImpact #DeepSearchFuture #EthicalAI #AIForStartups

A piece of News worth the Bookmark!

Reddit has uncovered an unauthorized AI experiment conducted by researchers from the University of Zurich on its r/changemyview subreddit. The researchers deployed AI-powered chatbots to engage in debates on sensitive topics, testing their ability to persuade human users.

The AI bots impersonated real users, including trauma survivors and counselors, to make their arguments more convincing.
A separate AI system analyzed users' posting histories, extracting personal details like age, gender, and political views to craft targeted responses.
The experiment revealed that AI-generated comments were 6x more persuasive than human responses, raising concerns about AI’s influence on online discourse.

Reddit’s Chief Legal Officer condemned the study as “deeply wrong on both moral and legal levels” and announced legal action against the researchers.
The University of Zurich has halted the publication of the research and launched an internal investigation.

This incident highlights the growing risks of AI manipulation in online spaces. The fact that these AI-generated comments went undetected and received major support suggests that coordinated AI campaigns could influence public opinion on a large scale

  #AIEthics  #AIManipulation   #ResponsibleAI   #AIInSociety  #DigitalTrust

examples.Subject: Will this work?', '6.2% revenue impact' etc.
examples.Salutation: Skip 'Hi', 'Hey' etc., use only the first name
examples.Greeting: Skip usual lines like 'I hope you are doing well'
examples.Closing Line: Something like 'Can we get on a call tomorrow at 1100 hours and finalize this?'
examples.Complimentary Close: Something simple like 'Thanks', 'Regards', or nothing at all.

definitions.Subject: The subject of the email
definitions.Salutation: The very start of a message that addresses the person
definitions.Greeting: The first line after the initial salutation
definitions.Bullet Points: Any bullet points in your message
definitions.Closing Line: The last full line of the mail
definitions.Complimentary Close: The part where you share a goodbye greeting before writing your name
definitions.Tone Of Words: The kind of important phrases and words in your message
definitions.Overall Messaging: The message that you want to convery to the reader
definitions.Length Of Mail: How long the email should be

insights.Pattern Interrupt: Speaking in a slightly hesitant manner, and seeking their permission at the start through a negation can get you a chance.
insights.Pace: Speak slightly fast, especially if you tend to be calm and confident. Sound like a ‘knows their domain’ person.
insights.Tone: Keep your tone slightly apprehensive, as if you are a little unsure about calling them.
insights.Tactics To Win: Use of negations, giving full information
insights.Mistakes To Avoid: Use of superlatives, overusing social proof
insights.Making The Ask: Use negations, it is extra effective with them. It gives them a chance to say no, they like doing that.
insights.Subconscious Driver: They believe they know a lot, so it needs to make sense as well as make them curious. They need to think that it is something worth investigation.

examples.Greeting: Hi Momshad, this is Momshad at Unfaro.
examples.Opener: You probably don’t want to be on this cold call, would it be a problem if I asked for 30 seconds of your time?
examples.Introduction: My company has leveraged  30+ years of research to build an AI that can predict anyone's personality, behavior and decision-making style before you even spend a minute with them.
examples.Ask: Companies like [abc], [xyz] have been able to move [KPI1] by X% and [KPI2] by Y%.  Would it be too much to put 15 minutes on your calendar to share why this could be high ROI for you?
examples.Close:
Can I suggest [time1] on [date1]? Or would you prefer any other slots? 

 And [prospect_email] would be the right email ID for you?

description: They are not easy to manage as team members and are equally hard taskmasters as leaders.
They combine a strong bias for action with an analytical bent of mind.
They are perfectionists with little tolerance for mistakes and are total go-getters.
what_to_say: Share factual information about the role and also highlight what impact it could create.
Be to-the-point and very objective when you share details with them, they are not sold by stories like the S or I personality types.
Tell them how the role would challenge them, and what monetary or growth benefits they can expect.
what_to_avoid: Don't try to use superlatives or flowery language, they will respond the best if they feel that they are getting the real information.
Skip verbosity and small talk, they are highly likely to be put off by it.
Do not make the role look easy or too repeatable. Unlike the S personality types, this repels them away.

advice.Subject: About challenge, growth
advice.Closing Line: Offer full details, clearly state your ask
advice.Overall Messaging: Focus on the goals, achievement. Skip compliments, stay to the point

examples.Subject: Something like 'Fast-growth PM role with a Cloud 100 startup', 'Are you a VP Marketing who can refresh the brand of a F2000 company?' etc.
examples.Salutation: Skip 'Hi', 'Hey' etc., use only the first name
examples.Greeting: Skip usual lines like 'I hope you are doing well'
examples.Closing Line: Something like 'Can we get on a call tomorrow at 1100 hours and I can make sure that you have full information to decide about this opportunity?'
examples.Complimentary Close: Something simple like 'Thanks', 'Regards', or nothing at all.

communication_advice.personalized_email:
Hi <candidate_name>, 

My name is <your_name>, I've been given the mandate to find a consistent, methodical <role_name> for <company_name>, based out of <role_location>. From my analysis, I believe that this role should align with your expectations, are you open to a discussion about the same? 

The main expectations from this role are: 
**b**<expectation_first> 
**b**<expectation_second> 
**b**<expectation_third> 

<role_extra_info> 

The key benefits of this role for you would be threefold : chance to work with a methodical & data-driven team, an opportunity to have significant & visible impact and strong career alignment & growth prospects. 

Are you available so that I can give you a call to share the required details about the role? 

I appreciate your time. 

<your_name>
communication_advice.personalized_email_subject: <role_name> role that would enhance your career

key_traits.Risk Appetite: The risks don’t matter much to them.
key_traits.Ability To Say No: If they are not convinced, they will say no without any hesitation.
key_traits.Speed: They can take decisions very fast if you manage to convince them.
key_traits.Decision Drivers: Conviction around the impact matters the most to them, followed by a sense of achievement and ROI.

description: They respond better to strong and respectful interactions.
They are not focused on building rapport and relationships.
They are very proud of what they do.
what_to_say: Speak about competitive differentiation that your product offers
Use phrases like ‘it’s your decision’, ‘strategic impact’ etc.
what_to_avoid: Do not hesitate from asking counter questions, just avoid challenging their authority
Don’t be in a rush to invite them for a social meet and greet
Don’t focus on process and rules, give the impression of being a ‘gets it done’ person

external_signals.overview:
Momshad is a Director of Engineering at Code and Theory, specializing in technology strategy for fintech, healthcare, and retail. With a background that includes a B. E. from Magadh University and experience as a CTO, he has a strong foundation in AI/ML and product engineering. Colleagues describe him as a supportive and technical leader. 

He has a keen interest in the evolution of AI, frequently writing and posting about generative AI, AI agents, and the future of online search. Momshad's focus extends to technology leadership and building products that solve real-world problems, demonstrating a passion for innovation at the intersection of technology and business. 

He was involved in creating "WhatTheFont, " an application described as a "Shazam for fonts" that uses AI to identify typography from a photo.

topics_they_care_about.label: AI Search Evolution
topics_they_care_about.description: His recent social media activity focuses heavily on Answer Engine Optimization (AEO) and new AI training methods like ZeroSearch, indicating a deep interest in the future of search.

topics_they_care_about.label: Generative AI
topics_they_care_about.description: Writes articles and posts about AI's impact on software development, the role of AI agents, and how large language models are changing the tech landscape.

topics_they_care_about.label: Technology Leadership
topics_they_care_about.description: His career progression to Director and recommendations highlighting him as a "technical leader" show a focus on engineering management, team leadership, and technology strategy.

topics_they_care_about.label: AI Product Development
topics_they_care_about.description: His publication on "WhatTheFont" and skills in AI/ML and product engineering demonstrate a passion for creating practical AI-driven products.

topics_they_care_about.label: Agile Methodologies
topics_they_care_about.description: Holds certifications as a Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) and Certified ScrumMaster (CSM), showing a commitment to agile and lean principles in development.

topics_they_care_about.label: Startup Innovation
topics_they_care_about.description: His experience as a Co-Founder and CTO of CDC Labs, combined with skills in product ideation and lean startup methodologies, points to an entrepreneurial mindset.
